emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Drone Swarms
emerging_technologies.description: Swarms of drones that can operate autonomously, performing coordinated tasks with minimal human intervention.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for increased efficiency in monitoring and intervention tasks, but raises privacy concerns and risks of misuse.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval for autonomous flight, advancements in AI for real-time decision-making, and public acceptance of drone technology.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Mental Health Assistants
emerging_technologies.description: AI agents capable of providing initial assessments, emotional support, and personalized mental health guidance.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increased access to mental health services, but ethical concerns about AI replacing human therapists and data privacy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Acceptance by healthcare providers, integration into existing health systems, and public trust in AI for sensitive personal matters.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-based Identity Management
emerging_technologies.description: Utilization of blockchain for secure, decentralized, and verifiable identity management systems.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances personal data security and privacy, but requires global standards and regulatory frameworks.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Development of interoperable blockchain networks, regulatory support, and overcoming public skepticism.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Agents for Personal Assistance
mainstream_technologies.description: AI agents capable of performing a wide range of personal tasks from scheduling to home automation.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in both consumer and enterprise markets, becoming standard tools for productivity and convenience.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Infrastructure that integrates AI for real-time monitoring, optimization, and autonomous management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming the norm in urban planning, with cities adopting AI-driven traffic, waste, and energy management systems.

epoch_themes.description: The era where autonomous systems become more prevalent, raising ethical questions about AI decision-making.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Increased efficiency but also ethical dilemmas regarding autonomy, privacy, and the role of AI in human decision-making.
epoch_themes.global_trends: A shift towards more autonomous governance in technology, with a focus on ethical AI frameworks and regulations.

epoch_themes.description: A movement towards decentralized systems to enhance privacy and security.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals with control over their data, but requires a paradigm shift in data management and governance.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased adoption of blockchain for various applications, leading to a more secure and transparent digital ecosystem.
